questions.text: Which of the following is not a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: There is no separate Float type as the JavaScript 'Number' data type represents both integers and float numbers.

questions.text: What keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript that cannot be reassigned?
questions.explanation: The 'const' keyword(short for constant) is used to declare variables that cannot be reassigned.

questions.text: Which image shows the correct HTML structure?
questions.explanation: Option 1 uses <h1> incorrectly in place of a <title>. Option 3 uses <header> and <footer> instead of <head> and <body>.

questions.text: What is the output of console.log(typeof []);
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, arrays are objects, so 'typeof []' returns 'object'.

questions.text: What method is used to add an element to the end of an array in JavaScript? No '()' in answer
questions.explanation: The push() method is used to add one or more elements to the end of an array.

questions.text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to set the color of text.

questions.text: What HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink? <?>
questions.explanation: The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.text: Which of the following shows the correct way to change the text color for all paragraphs in a file?
questions.explanation: The first inamge shows the correct way to change the text in all paragraphs. a '#' refers to elements that have an id = p, and a '.' refers to elements that have a class = p.
The correct meaning for CSS is Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.text: What does the acronym DOM stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for web documents.
